election_record.label: Massachusetts 1810 House of Representatives, Pelham

overview.note: "The defeated candidate had served for several terms but failed of a re-election. His brother, James Abercrombie, being elected by a majority of two. Both were sons of Rev. Robert Abercrombie, the first settled minister in the town. It was a contest that quite likely brought out a full voting strength of the town." History of Pelham, Mass., 180.

election_record.reference: Parmenter, C. O. History of Pelham, Mass.: from 1738 to 1898, Including the Early History of Prescott. Amherst, MA: Press of Carpenter and Morehouse, 1898. 180.
